Subjective: Left ear pain and feeling of fullness ('water in ear') for 3 days. Gradual onset. Pain worsens after showering. Meds: No painkillers. Negatives: No fever, no trauma. Social: Recent swimming activity, occasional ear cleaning with cotton buds. ICE (Concern): Worried about ear, wants pain to stop. Impact on daily life: Reduced swimming activity.
Objective: Temp 36.2 C. Right ear: normal. Left ear: red, inflamed, swollen ear canal, eardrum not visible.
Plan: 1. Paracetamol up to 4000mg/day as needed. 2. Anti-inflammatory ear drops 3x daily for 1 week. 3. Avoid ear cleaning with cotton buds. 4. Keep ear dry for 1 week. 5. Follow-up consultation in 1 week.
